meanings.definition: To bestow something in generous or extravagant quantities.
meanings.sent1: She lavished praise on her students for their hard work.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy philanthropist lavished donations on various charities.
meanings.sent3: The chef lavished the dish with exotic spices, creating a burst of flavors.
meanings.sent4: The artist lavished attention on every detail of the painting, making it truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The garden was lavished with care, resulting in a beautiful array of colorful flowers.

meanings.sent1: The mother lavished love and affection on her newborn baby.
meanings.sent2: The generous host lavished his guests with delicious food and drinks.
meanings.sent3: The magician lavished the audience with a spectacular show, leaving everyone amazed.
meanings.sent4: The sun lavished warmth on the beach, inviting people to relax and enjoy.
meanings.sent5: The rain lavished the fields with much-needed water, helping the crops grow.

meanings.definition: To spend or give freely and in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: The king lavished gold and jewels on his loyal subjects.
meanings.sent2: The company lavished bonuses on its hardworking employees.
meanings.sent3: The child lavished affection on their pet dog, showering it with hugs and kisses.
meanings.sent4: The storm lavished the town with heavy rain, causing flooding in the streets.
meanings.sent5: The artist lavished time and effort on the masterpiece, creating a work of art.
